call-us: Call us to speak to a Canada Pension Plan representative for help during the hours of operation listed below.
self-service: This phone number also provides an automated service available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. You can use self-service options to:
self-service.li.2: confirm your monthly payment amount and date
before-call.dd: To access information about your account, you will need to provide your Social Insurance Number and other personal information.
phone-numbers.canada.dt: Canada and the United States phone numbers
phone-numbers.itl.dt: Canada and the United States phone numbers
hours-of-operation.dd.1: For Canada and the United States phone numbers: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm local time, Monday to Friday, except statutory holidays.
hours-of-operation.dd.2: For outside Canada and the United States phone number: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Eastern time, Monday to Friday, except statutory holidays.
wait-times.dd: Our service standard is to answer your call within 10 minutes.
automated-hours.dd: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
ask-us-to-call-you: You can ask us to call you. Fill out the form to let us know how we can help you. We will contact you by phone within 2 business days.
assistance: The assistance you can obtain is limited to the following situations:
assistance.li.2: obtain help applying for the Canada Pension Plan including the Death Benefit, Survivor Benefit, Disability with a Terminal Illness
assistance.li.3: submit additional information and supporting documents (for example, power of attorney, death certificate, proof of marital, legal, residence status, medical report)
before-contact.dd: You need to provide your name, country, province or territory, and phone number when filling out the form.
callback-form.dd.aria: Fill out eServiceCanada callback form - Opens in a new tab
ask-not-visit: We ask you not to visit Service Canada Centres unless necessary, due to COVID-19 health guidelines.
before-come.dd.1: You need to show valid ID and answer verification questions at Service Canada Centres to access your file. No ID is required to ask about our services.
before-come.dd.3.li.1: a passport (Canadian or foreign) or permanent resident card
before-come.dd.3.li.2: a Certificate of Indian Status issued by the Government of Canada
before-come.dd.3.li.3: a provincial or territorial ID card or drivers license
before-come.dd.4.li.3: a certificate of registration of birth abroad
find-location.dd.aria: Find a Service Canada Centre - Opens in a new tab
person.hours.dd.2: Find a Service Canada Centre to see their hours of operation
select-province: Select your province or territory to find the mailing address of the Service Canada Centre where you can send your documents. If you are outside of Canada, mail them to the Centre assigned to the province where you last resided.

addressList.title: For postal codes beginning with L, M or N
For postal codes beginning with K or P
For Canada Pension Plan and Disability applications
